Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael!?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh! God. Dwight, come on...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I wanted to talk to you about the downsizing?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There's no downsizing.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I, but if there were, I'd be protected as assistant regional manager?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Assistant to the regional manager Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, so I don't have to worry?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Look, look, look. I talked to corporate, about protecting the sales staff. And they said they couldn't guarantee it if there's downsizing, okay?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: But there's no downsizing, so just don't...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Bottom line. Do I need to be worried?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mmm, mm, mm. Maybe.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It looks like there's gonna be downsizing. And it's part of my job, but... blah! I hate it. I think the main difference between me and Donald Trump is that, uh, I get no pleasure out of saying the words, "You're fired." [as Donald Trump] "You're foir-ed. Uh, you're foir-ed." It just makes people sad, and an office can't function that way. No way. [as Donald Trump] "You're foir-ed." I think if I had a catchphrase it would be, "You're hired, and you can work here as long as you want." But that's unrealistic, so...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's a real shame, 'cause studies have shown that more information gets passed through water-cooler gossip than through official memos. Which puts me at a disadvantage, because I bring my own water to work.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Why'd you do this?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I didn't do it. What do you mean? Oh, the water cooler was brought over here for... maintenance. So what do you guys hear? What's the scuttlebutt?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Get set for Operation Morale Improvement starring Michael Scott. Now, I think I have had a little stroke of genius in that I have had my assistant Pam... Smile, Pam. I have had her go out and find out whose birthday is coming up, so we can have a little celebration for it. Not bad, not bad at all. All right. And the birthday person is... drum roll please. Here we go, who is the birthday, birthday person?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Who is it? Who's the birthday?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Um... Actually, we don't have any staff birthdays coming up.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Next person on the...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...calendar.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay, umm... that would be Meredith.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes! All right, come on down Meredith!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: But it's not until next month.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um... uh, OK. Well, great, well, you know, it'll be a surprise.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You still want to have a party?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, why not? Sure. Go ahead, live a little. Come on, Pam. Come on, shake it up. Shake it up! Shake it up!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [grabs cell phone off desk] Brrrp! Uh, Spock, are there any signs of life down there? Well, let me check Captain. Eeee. Eeee. Eeee. Eeee. No, Captain. No signs of life down here. Just a wet blanket named Pam. Brr-rrrp. Star Trek.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Well, uh, for decorations, maybe we could... it's stupid, forget it.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I was just going to say, maybe we could have streamers, but that's dumb, everybody has streamers. Never mind.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No, yeah, I think that's a good idea.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What color do you guys think?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Well, there's green, um, blue... yellow... red...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: How about green?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I think green is kind of whoreish.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: This was tough. I suggested we flip a coin. But Angela said she doesn't like to gamble. Of course by saying that she was gambling that I wouldn't smack her.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: These are my party-planning beeyatches. Pulled off an amazing '80s party last year. Off the hook!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So I was thinking, if you haven't already got a cake, um, maybe going for one of those ice-cream cakes from Baskin-Robbins. Those are very good. Very Delicious.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Meredith's allergic to dairy, so...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: She's not the only one that's going to be eating it, right? I think everybody likes ice-cream cake. It's not, uh, it's not just about her, so...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It is... her birthday.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mint chocolate chip! That'd be good, how about some, mint chocolate chip?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey, so listen, I was thinking that it might be a good idea if you and I formed an alliance. 'Cause of the downsizing? I think an alliance might be a good idea, you know. Help each other out.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Do you want to form, an alliance, with me?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Absolutely, I do.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Good, good. Excellent, OK. Now we need to figure out who's vulnerable and who's protected...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: At that moment, I was so happy. I mean, everything Dwight does annoys me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Did you get your tickets?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: To what?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The gun show. [Rolls up his sleeve and kisses his bicep]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And I spend hours thinking of ways to get back at him, but only in ways that could get me arrested. And then here he comes and he says "No, Jim, here's a way."

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: There's one other thing and this is important. Let's keep this alliance totally a secret. Don't tell anyone.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: An alliance?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What does that even mean?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I think it has something to do with Survivor, but I'm not sure.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Um, I know that it involves spying on people and we may build a fort, underground.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jim! Hey. Hi, Pam. Listen, could I talk to you a second about the... paper products?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Did you tell Pam about the alliance?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What? No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Just now.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What? Oh no no no. Dwight, no. I'm using her, for the alliance. Who knows the most information about this office? Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Right, that's good, good, pursue this.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well I'm trying to. Do you see what I'm doing?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Mmm hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: But listen, I'm going to have to talk to her a lot. All right? And there may be chatting, and giggling. And you gotta just pretend to ignore it. Wipe it away.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Done.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [to the camera] Can you get her? She's right there. [camera zooms in on Meredith at here desk] That is Meredith, the birthday girl. And this... is Meredith's card. Happy Bird-Day. [laughs] Um, let's see. Jim, Jim wrote, "Meredith, I heard you're turning 46, but, come on, you're an accountant. Just fudge the numbers." Not bad, pretty funny, I don't appreciate condoning corporate fraud though. Uh, here's the thing. Whatever I write here has to be really, really funny. Because people out there are expecting it. I've already set the bar really high. And they're all worried about their jobs, you know. It's kinda dark out there. Can you imagine if I wrote something like, uh, "Oh, Meredith. Happy Birthday. You're great. Love, Michael." [pretends to vomit and laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: They seem awfully chummy, don't you think?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, what do you think that's about?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Only one way to find out.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm on it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You are not going to believe this.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What? I believe it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, tensions were high in the kitchen.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I could tell, from the body language.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey Kev, that looks good. What is it? Turkey?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Italian.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, Italian. Nice. Wow! You got the works there. Red onion, provolone...

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Toby and Kevin, they're trying to get Angela kicked off.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Good, let 'em. It helps our cause.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, I don't know, if Kevin's in accounting, and Toby's in Human Resources and they're talking...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, they're forming an alliance

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I love their sandwiches.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I love their sandwiches too.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Their bread's really good.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Their bread is very good.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Damn it. God!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK, listen, we need to assume that everyone in the office is forming an alliance and is therefore trying to get us kicked off.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: God... Damn it! Why us?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Because we're strong, Dwight. Because we're strong.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [staring at birthday card] Meredith, Meredith... Meri... Mary had a little lamb. Mary... Meredith had a little lamb. Don't bring that lamb to work or it'll poop on the floor.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, Oscar! Come on in. What's up?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Uh, I'm sorry to bother you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, not at all. Come on in. What's going on?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: My nephew is involved with, um, a charity for cerebral palsy, and I was wondering if maybe you'd like to... you know... if...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Donate to the charity?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, God. Of course I would. Get it over here. Get that over here.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I'm always good... for some serious buckage. Wow. Two dollars, three dollars? People out here do not care about diseases. I am going to give you... $25.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: That's... that's... that's very generous.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, my gosh, well... Listen, Oscar, generosity and togetherness and community all convalescences into... morale. That's what I say, so...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [whispering] Hey, Jim, can I talk to you for a second?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Sure, what's up?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Um, I don't know, I'm just like, I'm going a little crazy 'cause I keep overhearing all these conversations between Michael and corporate about like, staff issues?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh no?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, he's making me take notes on these meetings and I'm, like, "These people are my friends." But he's all like, "This is confidential. You can't tell anybody." But I just feel like I want to... aaah. Just promise me you're not gonna say anything.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, will not, I'm not going to tell anybody. This is between you and me.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: OK, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jackpot.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That was beautiful. All her idea too. Awesome. She is so great.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [looking at birthday card] Meredith, bad breath. Meredith has bad breath.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey, you wanted to see me?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah. What do you know about Meredith?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I don't think she'd be missed.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There's not going to be downsizing Dwight, OK? I just, I need to know a little bit more about my friend.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Name, Meredith Palmer. Uh, personal information, divorced twice, two kids. Uh, Employer, Dunder Mifflin Paper Incorporated. Awards, multiple Dundies.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know all that. I know all that. I just, I need something kind of embarrassing, you know. Kind of fun, inside.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: She had a hysterectomy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [laughs] Which one is that again?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's where they remove the uterus.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh God! Dwight, no. I'm trying to write something funny. What am I going to do with a removed uterus?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It could be kind of funny.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what, I am on a deadline here, and just... OK. Thanks, thanks for your help. I'll work it out. Thank you Dwight. That was a waste of time.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK, here's the deal. All right? Pam says that one of the alliances is meeting in the warehouse during Meredith's birthday.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh my God, we have to be there.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I know, but it's gonna be a little tough because there's no good place to hide there.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No no, yes there is. Behind the shelves. Oh my God.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What? What?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I know. I know exactly what to do.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [gives Dwight a high five] Great.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm a deer hunter. I go all the time with my dad. One thing about deer, they have very good vision. One thing about me, I am better at hiding than they are... at vision.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This is going to be perfect, OK? Centrally located. Perfect cover. I can hear and see everything.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Good.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Michael? Are you done yet?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Almost there. Just a sec. Just a second. It is perfect, thank you. Excellent, here we go. It is time, thank you. OK, come on. Let's go! Get the cake. Here we go. Come on! Shhh. Be quiet.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wait, this isn't gonna work. The lid's open.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So tape it down.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I can't do that. You won't be able to breathe.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Look, I can breathe just fine. OK, but if it makes you feel better, I'll poke holes in the box.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thank you, thank you. OK.

Quote.Speaker: Everybody
Quote.Text: Surprise!

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Oh! Surprise.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No, it's ah...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's surprise Meredith. One, two...

Quote.Speaker: Everybody
Quote.Text: [tunelessly] Happy birthday to you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Find a key.

Quote.Speaker: Everybody
Quote.Text: Happy birthday...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So do you want me to stay here and, you know, stand next to the box?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, you need to go upstairs to the party so people don't notice we're both gone.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Right... That's good.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Can I trust Jim? I don't know. Do I have a choice? No, frankly, I don't. Will I trust Jim? Yes. Should I trust Jim? You tell me.

Quote.Speaker: Everybody
Quote.Text: [singing] ... birthday, dear Meredith Happy birthday to you...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And many more!

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Last year, five years ago...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You were surprised, weren't you?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You looked freaked, man. We said "Surprise." You were, like, "What?" "What the hell's goin' on here?" Good cake. Why don't you have some?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Uh, I can't. Um...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Come on. A little bit.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I can't eat dairy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, right. God, too bad. It's so good.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Yeah, it makes me sick.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what? If I were allergic to dairy, I think I'd kill myself. 'Cause this is way, way too good.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: He's in a box?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pam, he's in a box. He's downstairs, in a box, on the floor, near the shelves. I'm serious. Go down there and work your magic.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [on her cell phone] Hey where are you? Yeah, we were supposed to meet here. What? Oh my gosh! That ties in perfectly with something that Michael was telling me earlier! I just don't know what some of the people in, like, accounting are going to do? It said specifically that...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [box falls over] Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Jim, good party, huh? Just a little something I whipped up. You know, a little morale boost. No big deal.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Speaking of which, I meant to tell you. Very impressive, the uh, donation you gave to Oscar's charity. What was it? 25 bucks?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, you know, money isn't everything Jim. It's not the key to happiness. You know what is? Joy. You should remember that. Maybe you'll give more than three dollars next time.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, well, three dollars a mile. It's gonna end up being like 50 bucks. So... God, I can't even calculate what you're gonna have to give.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Is Oscar around?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I just thought it was kind of a flat, you know... 25 dollar, one-time donation. I didn't think it was per mile kinda deal. You know, so...

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Well, that's what a walk-a-thon is.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know...

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: It says it right on the sheet. Look, look at the sheet. It says, "However many dollars per mile."

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Right. Got it. Yes. So it does. Um...

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I just think it's kind of cheap to un-donate money to a charity.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no, no, no. That wasn't what I wasn't, that wasn't... No. It-it-it's not about the money. It's just... it... it's the ethics of the thing, Oscar. How's your nephew? Is he in good shape?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How many miles did he do last year?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Last year, he walked 18 miles.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Son of a bitch. That is impressive.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Happy Birthday. [gives Meredith her card]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Read it out loud. And say who wrote everything so we know whose is the best.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: "Happy Bird-day" Um... "Meredith, good news. You're not actually a year older because you work here, where time stands still."

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [under his breath] I don't know about that.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: That was Stanley. "Meredith, happy birthday, you're the best. Love, Pam."

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [pretends to vomit] Huh! Thanks, downer.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: This is from Michael. "Meredith, let's hope the only downsizing that happens to you is that someone downsizes your age."

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Because of the downsizing. Rumors. And because you're gettin' old.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: No, I... I get it. It's funny.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [laughs] You didn't get the joke. So, that's cool. That's, you know what? Actually... I have a bunch of these, good ones, that I didn't use. Um... Oh, where's that? Oh, OK, here's a good one. Um... "Hey Meredith, Liz Taylor called, she wants her age back and her divorces back." 'Cause Meredith's been divorced like, twice. Is that right?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: You're right. You're right. Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Divorce. Um... OK, "Meredith is so old..."

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: How old is she?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Everybody? If... could do it? "Meredith is so old..."

Quote.Speaker: Everybody
Quote.Text: How old is she?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: "She's so old, she went into an antique store and they kept her."

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That wasn't even mine. I got that off the Internet. Website. Um, don't get mad at me.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Uh, nice party Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This isn't my fault. Ladies, not your best effort. The streamers? I think we could have done better than that.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Phyllis wanted red, I didn't.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Oh, boy... You...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK, we... all right. People, hold on, hold on. Just a second. OK, I think we're losing sight of what is really important here. And that is that we are... a group of people... who work together. I was... I really wasn't gonna flaunt this. I have made a very sizable donation to Oscar's nephew's... walkathon. $25.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Per mile.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Per mile, yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: When I retire, I... don't want to just disappear to an island somewhere. I wanna be the guy who gives everything back.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: A check for the kids, and for the team.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I want it to be like... "Hey, who donated that hospital wing that is saving so many lives?" "Um, well, I don't, I don't know. It was anonymous." "Well, guess what, [whispering] that was Michael Scott." "But it was anonymous, how do you know?" "Because I'm him."

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Thank you, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Come here. [hugs Oscar and In a low voice] Don't cash that till Friday, OK?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Really? Today?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Oh, Happy Birthday.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yeah, I could say something.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: No, don't. Don't do that.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK, OK. I have something that totally tops the box.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, tell me, tell me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK. I have just convinced Dwight that he needs to go to Stamford and... [Pam starts laughing]... spy on our other branch. No no no.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: But before he does so, I told him that he should dye his hair to go undercover.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [laughing] That's perfect!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: If we can get him to drive to Connecticut... and put peroxide in his hair...

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: [yelling] What the hell is this? What are you trying to cop a feel or something? Huh Halpert?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, no, dude, no.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, dude, no, I was just, listen! Whoa.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Come on.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: God, I don't even, I don't even know how to explain this. Uh, um... Dwight, uh, asked me to be in an alliance. And then um... um... we were... we've just been messing with him. Uh, because of the whole alliance thing. Um...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's just office pranks.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's stupid. It's, it's just office pranks.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: [looking at Dwight] An alliance? What the hell is he talking about?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I have absolutely no idea.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Come on.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Do I feel bad about betraying Jim? Not at all. That's the game. Convince him we're in an alliance, get some information, throw him to the wolves.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [With blonde hair] That's politics baby. Get what you can out of someone, then crush them. I think Jim might have learned a very valuable lesson.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Good, excellent, and file sharing off and done. Security software, 128-bit encryption, firewalls. Get up, I'll install it on your computer.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Pssh, stupid. Identity theft happens all the time. I can become you like that. [snaps fingers] But no one can become me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No one wants to be you, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Not true. And if they did, they couldn't because I'm password protected.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Is your password Frodo?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No. [typing on keyboard]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Did you just change it to Gollum?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No. [typing on keyboard]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [telephone rings] Dunder Mifflin, this is Pam. Hold please.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All righty then, well I see you're going for the whole bored supermodel thing. "Dunder Mifflin, this is Pam. May I help you?" [takes a drag from an imaginary cigarette] Smoke, smoke, smoke, smoke.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I wasn't really going for anything.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no. I get it, I get it, I get it. A child is born, "Oh, oh-hum." A beautiful sunset, "No, I'll catch the next one." Right? Unicorn walks into the office, "Oh, do you have an appointment?" [laughs] Okay, look Pam this is not meant as a criticism, but let me tell you what you're doing wrong. You are the voice of this company, right? And when clients call and you're not smiling they can hear that in your voice. It is a real turnoff.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Are you being serious?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, I am, absolutely. So, the next call we get I'd like you to smile. I'd like to see a big smile.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. [waits for call]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No one's calling.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know, somebody will. And we'll wait.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Sometimes there's a lot of time between the calls.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know, I know, we will wait.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We will wait for the call and you will smile. Let me try something, just while we're waiting.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Tell me if I'm smiling or not. [covers face with hands] Hi Pam, how are you? Was I smiling?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, let me try this one. [covers face with hands] Hi Pam, how are you?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I mean you can tell.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, I could tell.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I wasn't smiling that time and they can tell too.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That was a good example.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you. All right, when we get a call I'll come back and you'll do the smile.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay. [telephone rings]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Show time! It's show time!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [smiling] Dunder Mifflin, this is Pam. One moment I'll transfer you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [throwing away a banana, mayonnaise, and a sandwich from the refrigerator, smells the mayonnaise] God. [drinks from the milk carton and puts it back] Mmm.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [looks in the refrigerator] Hey Dwight, my tuna sandwich isn't in the refrigerator. You wouldn't know anything about that would you?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It was rotting.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It was not rotting.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Any employee may dispose a food item...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Stop. Dwight, stop.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: ...that risks contaminating the other food item. Read the official kitchen regulations memo.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight, you wrote that memo. Okay, it's not an official memo.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Uh, uh, not my problem. Okay, this is a paper factory not a bacteria factory.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight, it's not a factory at all. Do you have to do what you are doing? [Dwight is tapping each of the bobble heads on his desk and making them bobble]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Uh, if they don't bobble, what's the point?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What is this?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: My nephew does it every year. Anything you could give would be fantastic.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Okay, but I don't want to be put on a mailing list.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We need to assume that everyone in the office is forming an alliance and is therefore trying to get us kicked off.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: God... Damn it! Why us?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Because we're strong, Dwight. Because we're strong. God, it's freezing, I gotta go in. You stay though for like five minutes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [talking over Jim] Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You don't want to arouse suspicion.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'll stay for ten.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Good. I like it. You know what. Pretend to smoke. [Dwight pretends to smoke]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do a poem for Meredith's birthday or uh, limerick. Limerick. Um, [knock on door] there was a girl from Dunder Mifflin. Come on in. Who had a big, smifflin.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Hi, do you mind if I sign the card real quick?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, not at all come on in. [Toby signing the birthday card] No, no. You can't. No, red hair is my area. We have it on tape, so...

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: It's just a birthday card.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I was going to put that in my message, Toby. All right? So just cross it off. Cross it off, now. [Toby writes on birthday card] What are you doing? Oh come on, you're ruining it. Toby, come on. Just, look at that. That's wrecked. Ass. Get some white out.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: There's some right there.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's my white out. Get your own white out. Just... what's the matter with you? God. [Toby leaves] Okay, um, there was a girl from Dunder Mifflin. Who had a big, puttifflin. [thinking out loud] Mifflin, spifflin.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh, by the way. Have you heard Dwight say the word immunity, yet? Because if I can get Dwight to say the word immunity, it might be the greatest day of my life.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You wanted to see me?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh, yeah. What do you know about Meredith?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I don't think she'd be missed.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There's not going to be downsizing Dwight, OK? I just, I need to know a little bit more about my friend.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Name, Meredith Palmer. Uh, personal information, divorced twice, two kids. Uh, Employer, Dunder Mifflin Paper Incorporated. Awards, multiple Dundies.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know all that. I know all that. I just, I need something kind of embarrassing, you know. Kind of fun, inside.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: She had a hysterectomy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Which one is that again?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's where they remove the uterus.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh God! Dwight, no. I'm trying to write something funny here, okay. What am I going to do with a removed uterus?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It could be kind of funny.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [sighs] Come up with a joke that I can use, okay?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Mmm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Help me out here.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay. Hey Meredith, where's your uterus?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, not a uterus joke Dwight. Please. Something useable. A joke.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: If I find a joke for you, will you grant me immunity? [cut to Jim holding his hands up like a champion]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: From the downsizing.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There's not going to be downsizing, Dwight. You know what, I am on a deadline here and just, okay. Thanks. Thanks for your help. I'm... I'll work it out. Thank you Dwight. [Dwight leaves] Thanks for coming in, that's always... Always helpful when I give him a call. Call him in.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Meredith. Oh, oh man, ah gosh. I can't remember why I came over here. Ha, ha.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I hate that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know. Ugh, that is so annoying. [makes fart noise] Brain fart. By the way, do you remember any funny interactions we may have had recently that I've forgotten about? Just, you know we bumped into each and you said, "Brr, brr." And I went, "Argh, Argh." You know? Anything? [shakes her head 'no'] Well, if you think of something, let me know. 'Cause I like to know. 'Cause I'm going crazy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oscar, uh for future reference just think you should know, that you should probably make it clear that your nephew is doing the walkathon and that he doesn't actually have cerebral palsy. Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I never suggested...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no. I know you didn't intend to, but I just I got the idea and I, uh, I just don't it has a lot of ethical merit to make people think something. You know? And then prey on their emotions.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Michael, if I gave you...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, hey it's just kinda uncool, okay? I, just... Play fair, you know, play fair.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: "Meredith, let's hope the only downsizing that happens to you is that someone downsizes your age."

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Because of the downsizing. Rumors. And because you're gettin' old.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: No, I...I get it. It's funny.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [laughs] You didn't get the joke. So, that's cool. That's, you know what? Actually... I have a bunch of these, good ones, that I didn't use. Um... Oh, where's that? Oh, Okay, here's a good one. Um..."Hey Meredith, Liz Taylor called, she wants her age back and her divorces back." 'Cause Meredith's been divorced like, twice. Is that right?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: You're right. You're right. Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Divorce. Um... Okay, "Meredith is so old..."

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: How old is she?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: If everybody... could do it? "Meredith is so old..."

Quote.Speaker: Everybody
Quote.Text: How old is she?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: "She's so old, she went into an antique store and they kept her."

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [clears throat] What's the difference between Meredith and Michael Jackson? Michael Jackson's surgery was unnecessary.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: You're talking about my hysterectomy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes! Thank you. God. She gets it. [laughs] We just picked the best one right? Just had it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [whispering] I'm so sorry. [Angela, Phyllis, and Pam all whispering] ... seriously, we're just...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um, no, no. Come on. No. Don't comfort... don't comfort her, that's not... She doesn't need comforting. We're just joking around. I think she's... No that's very unprofessional. I think she's being very unprofessional over there.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm only going to ask you this once. Are you part of an alliance?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well played.
